OVERVIEW: The Bundo series consists of deep, moderately rapidly permeable soils that formed in colluvium and alluvium derived from acid igneousintrusive rocks on mountain slopes.  Slopes range from 25 to 60 percent.  Mean annual precipitation is 22 inches, and the mean annual temperature is 38 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Ustic Palecryalfs

(4 to 8 inches thick)

(20 to 28 inches thick)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Colfax County, New Mexico; about 2.5 miles northeast of Eagle Nest, New Mexico; one mile northeast of the northeast end of the Eagle Nest airstrip in line with the airstrip.  Unsectionized area.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Soil Temperature:  Averages 40 degrees F. and the average summer temperature is 49 degrees F.
Depth to argillic horizon:  45 to 70 inches.
Rock Fragments:  15 to 50 percent at surface, 35 to 85 percent in the control section.
E horizon:  Hue - 7.5YR or 10YR Value:  6 through 8 dry, 4 through 6 moist Chroma:  2 through 4, dry or moist Texture:  Loam or sandy loam
Bt horizon:  Hue - 7.5YR or 10YR Value:  5 or 6 dry or 3 through 5 moist Chroma:  2 through 6 dry or moist Texture:  Sandy clay loam or loam (10 to 25 percent clay and 50 percent or more sand.)

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Etoe, Horsethief and Marosa series.  Etoe soils have an argillic horizon with its upper boundary between 24 and 40 inches from the surface.  Horsethief soils have less than 50 percent sand in the argillic horizon.  Marosa soils have 25 percent or more clay in the control section.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  The Bundo soils are on steep and very steep, stony and gravelly, convex mountain slopes with elevations ranging from 8,000 to ll,500 feet.  The soils formed in medium textured, gravelly colluvial-alluvial material derived from acid igneous intrusive rocks.  The climate is continental with annual precipitation ranging from l8 to 25 inches.  Annual temperature is about 38 degrees F., and the average summer temperature is about 47 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Tolby soils.  Tolby soils lack argillic horizons.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Wildlife, recreation, and timber production.  Douglas-fir, Engelman spruce, white fir, and limber pine.  Understory is kinnikinnick, Oregon grape, mock orange, and some mountain grasses.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Northern New Mexico and southern Colorado.  This series is moderately extensive.
